subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Tuesday, 29 May, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Ferdinand, Dawson out for England
Rio Ferdinand and Michael Dawson pull out of England's matches against Brazil and Estonia with groin injuries.



 
Hargreaves close to Man Utd move
Owen Hargreaves is expected to complete his transfer to Manchester United next week, BBC Sport understands.



 
FA to have independent chairman
The Football Association will have an independent chairman after voting in favour of Lord Burns' structural review.








GOLF




Cautious Rose to miss USA event
England's Justin Rose pulls out of this week's Memorial Tournament in America.



 
Dredge eyes home Wales Open win
Bradley Dredge is on a quest to become the first home winner of the Celtic Manor Wales Open.



 
Hansen snatches victory from Rose
Anders Hansen edges a sudden-death play-off with Justin Rose to win the PGA Championship at Wentworth.








MOTORSPORT




Stewart backs McLaren on Hamilton
F1 great Sir Jackie Stewart says McLaren did the right thing in asking Fernando Alonso and Lewis Hamilton not to race in Monaco.



 
McLaren race victory to be probed
Formula One's governing body will investigate McLaren for a possible breach of the rules in Sunday's Monaco Grand Prix.



 
McLaren deny anti-Hamilton bias
McLaren say Lewis Hamilton is free to race team-mate Fernando Alonso despite imposing team orders at the Monaco Grand Prix.








FORMULA ONE




Stewart backs McLaren on Hamilton
F1 great Sir Jackie Stewart says McLaren did the right thing in asking Fernando Alonso and Lewis Hamilton not to race in Monaco.



 
McLaren race victory to be probed
Formula One's governing body will investigate McLaren for a possible breach of the rules in Sunday's Monaco Grand Prix.



 
McLaren deny anti-Hamilton bias
McLaren say Lewis Hamilton is free to race team-mate Fernando Alonso despite imposing team orders at the Monaco Grand Prix.








ATHLETICS




Redgrave rejects Chambers claims
Sir Steve Redgrave rejects Dwain Chambers' view that only athletes who use drugs can win Olympic titles.



 
Disgraced Chambers in drugs claim
Dwain Chambers claims there will always be athletes using performance-enhancing drugs because the scientists will remain one step ahead of the testers.



 
Weir secures double Dutch victory
British wheelchair racer David Weir wins the 100 and 400m races at the Thales FBK-Games in Holland.








CYCLING




Garzelli takes Giro stage success
Italian Stefano Garzelli wins the 16th stage of the Tour of Italy to Linz in Austria.



 
Team Milram vow to stand by Zabel
German cyclist Erik Zabel will continue to ride for Team Milram despite admitting to doping offences in 1996.



 
Ricco toils to mountain stage win
Saunier Duval rider Riccardo Ricco wins the gruelling 15th stage of the Tour of Italy.








FUN AND GAMES




Beck to the future
Robbo on how David Beckham's recall mirrors his return to the pub team



 
Review of the week
Graham Poll gets his air guitar out as the Liverpool parade bus stays in the garage



 
Farewell West Jesmond
BBC Sport's adopted team look back on their season
